Package shaharas

Class Div

java.lang.Object
shaharas.BaseOperators
shaharas.BaseBinaryOperators
shaharas.Div
All Implemented Interfaces:
Operators
public class Div extends BaseBinaryOperators
The Div class represents the division binary operator ("/") for performing integer division operations. It extends the BaseBinaryOperators class and provides the necessary logic to handle division operations. This class is used to perform division between two operands, ensuring proper handling of division by zero and providing an appropriate error message when such an operation is attempted.

  • Constructor Details

    • Div

      public Div()
      Default constructor for the Div class. Initializes the operator with a default value of 0 and sets up the corresponding pattern, symbol, and priority for the division operation.

    • Div

      public Div(Div a)
      Copy constructor for the Div class. This constructor creates a new Div operator with the same properties as the provided Div object.
      Parameters:
      a - The Div object to copy.

    • Div

      public Div(int a)
      Constructor for the Div class that allows setting a specific initial value for the operator. It also sets the pattern, symbol, and priority for the division operation.
      Parameters:
      a - The initial value to set for the operator.

    • calculate

      public int calculate(String variable, int... args)
      Performs the division operation on the given operands.
      Specified by:
      calculate in interface Operators
      Specified by:
      calculate in class BaseBinaryOperators
      Parameters:
      variable - The variable used in the operation (not utilized in this method).
      args - The operands for the division. The first argument is divided by the second.
      Returns:
      The result of the division.
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - If the second operand (denominator) is zero, indicating division by zero.
